text: hi I'm Hannah wall trades and today I'm
gonna give you a quick snapshot of what
August on our farm looks like before I
get started I would love to give a huge
shout out to my sponsor Squarespace for
supporting this channel this really is
the best time of the year because
there's so much stuff that I can pick
and eat right away it's just so fun to
come out here and do my proverbial
grocery shopping I've got some eggplants
this is my favorite variety of cucumber
they're called market Moore and they
literally look like they glow in the
dark which they taste exactly the same
as regular cucumbers but hey they look
cool we've also got pickling cucumbers
out the wazoo we've got tons of tomatoes
that are just getting ripe I was able to
pick a few little Sun golds and
super-sweet 100's which are my favorite
little ones to grow but we also like to
grow a lot of heirloom tomatoes as well
this year we're growing way less
Tomatoes than I usually do because we're
doing some big farm projects and I
wanted to minimize the amount of
maintenance I had to do in the garden so
pretty much all this stuff out here is
taking care of itself I come out here
and I pick and I prune whatever I need
to but I haven't had to water the garden
all summer long
due to the woodchips and our increased
microbial soil health and just the fact
that it's rained every 10 days or so
here for the last all summer we really
haven't even had to water at all which
is fantastic because I put in this
awesome new irrigation system but I
still haven't actually gotten a chance
to hook it up thank God because I
haven't had to use it and of course with
every meal I try to fit in as much kale
as possible because we have so much this
year but this is fantastic to stew or to
stir-fry to add to morning smoothies and
they're also really yummy to put in
salads and to make and to make kimchi
one really fun thing right now is that
all the different-colored zinnias are
starting to bloom and I just love these
little pops of color in between all of
the veggies that are growing as well as
you can see behind me the amaranth is
starting to form at seed pods and that
will be able to be harvested and
grounded to grain plus it's also another
really beautiful thing one of my
absolute favorite vegetables is the
turnip and it's a good thing I liked it
so much because one of these could feed
a family of eight what turnip greens you
can stir-fry them stew them they're
really popular but the thing that's most
popular around here is tossing them to
my little buddies you guys want some
turnip greens
oh sorry maple but I also have you
notice too that in here these things
have been planted super closely together
and this is one of the huge benefits of
doing gardening the way that I do
because the soil is so loose that the
big root vegetables just push each other
out of their way and they are able to
grow and find space to grow just fine
beets are some of my favorite root
vegetables we have a bunch of different
varieties of beets this year and again
be creedence can be put into smoothies
or steamed or stewed or stir-fried but
guess who else really likes beet greens
you guys want to just eat them from a
bouquet in my hand it makes me so happy
to see these guys happy and there's
nothing better than a few little snack
keys everyone smile
another summer activity that goes on
every summer is that we share the
alpacas to both use their wool and also
to keep them nice and cool for the
summer so basically I'm just going
through my days trying to make sure that
I keep up on harvesting of course with a
garden this large sometimes I miss
things and you know they can bolt and go
to seed which is what what these are
doing these are creating seeds but
actually for a lot of places in the
garden I really don't mind that
happening I do a lot of seed collection
myself once they've created the seeds
I'll put those seeds in an envelope and
use them again either later this year or
later on next year as well but if
something really does bolt or get too
big to even use no problem at all
because I can go ahead and give it to
the chickens who will then convert that
wasted food into eggs so nothing really
ends up getting wasted
and worst case scenario they also don't
eat it it gets composted along with all
the other things we're composting then
it goes back into nutrients into the
soil to grow more stuff next year so
this is a pretty important part of our
composting and recycling system that we
have here on the farm the animals create
the manure and the compost and then we
bring it and we toss it in for the
chickens to stir and to really speed up
the decomposition process and all the
while they're adding their own manure
into it we're also using arborist chip
bedding in here which stirs all of that
into the compost as well and in a little
bit they will have stirred it all up
we'll be able to come back in with the
tractors and put it into a separate
compost pile that will then age and then
get used in our garden another very fun
thing that's going on on the farm right
now so we've got baby bunnies as if
bottle feeding lambs could not be a cute
explosion enough these little monsters
pretty much bring so much joy so these
are lion head Dwarfs and we breed them
as a way to offset our animal feed costs
and these are very popular 4h projects I
love to help mentor kids who are
interested in raising livestock of their
own and want to learn about breeding and
genetics and all kinds of things that
are really easy to study with rabbits
because they have a 28-day gestation
period which means that from breeding to
birthing it's a quite quick process and
so because rabbits can be bred at about
eight months of age that means that you
can create several generations of
rabbits in a fairly short timespan so
when you're studying things like
genetics and dominant and recessive
traits in animals that you're raising
this is a fantastic way to do it I've
been raising rabbits since I was six
maybe and they were pretty much the only
pet I could have because we traveled so
much that these were a low maintenance
enough pet for me to be able to have our
neighbors watch the bunnies when we were
out of town for long periods of time so
yeah these guys are pretty special I

not bottle feeding a little baby bunny
